No easy, in-built way. Are these folders static or constantlly being created? If static, you should be able to set their custom view while maintaining a different default template for that folder type.Keith
It seems that this only applies to child folders and not their subfolders.  The grandchild folders were not configured.

To change the folder view for all folders of the same type: - in Explorer navigate to the folder for which you want to change the view. Right click, choose properties, click on Customize. Under Optimize this folder for, in the drop down list choose a folder type. Tick the box for "Also apply this template to all subfolders". Click Apply and OK. - still in Explorer set the view for the folder as you wish. In the ribbon, at the far right under Options click on the arrow to select "change folder and search options". Click on the view tab and click on Apply to all folders, then yes then apply then OK.Please note that folder view choices are not maintained when you view the folder via a Library.If the above has not propagated to all subfolders including grand children, check the properties on a subfolder where this doesn't work. Has the type of folder been set correctly?-If yes post back. with details-If not: do the subfolders where the properties were not applied have different type of contents? (say you chose a Music type in the very first step and some folders have pictures in them). In this case you might need to disable automatic detection of folder type. This requires a registry edit. Is your system an upgrade from 7 to 10?
